response_text: The official pricing page for Yousign is: [https://yousign.com/pricing](https://yousign.com/pricing).【3:0†source】

Each plan includes the following
--------------------------------

*   ### Secure, compliant signatures
    
    Each signature meets eIDAS norms and our data is hosted in the EU to keep your documents safe.
    
*   ### Legally binding agreements
    
    All signatures automatically generate a time-stamped proof file to secure your agreements.
    
*   ### Signature tracking interface
    
    Follow each document in real-time from approval, sending, signing, to archiving in a simple dashboard.
    

And to go even further

Our range of add-ons
--------------------

### Choose the right signature level from our packages

*   #### Simple eSignature
    
    Have your documents signed in just a few clicks on a secure application to guarantee a legally valid signature while streamlining your processes.
    
*   #### Advanced eSignature (AES)
    
    Reinforce the legal value of your signatures by ensuring the identification of signers.
    

[Contact us](https://yousign.com/contact)

### Automate your document generation

*   #### Forms
    
    Optimize and accelerate the generation of your recurring documents with Forms before sending them for signature.
    

[Discover Forms](https://yousign.com/forms)

### Take it to the next level with the API

Integrate our API directly into your solutions to get your documents signed without interrupting your customer journey, at a discounted rate.

[API pricing](https://yousign.com/pricing-api)

![Image 42](https://images.prismic.io/yousigncom/6761932e-b3c9-4e52-aff8-06ddd37202f2_illu-API.png?auto=compress,format&rect=0,0,708,538&w=480&h=365)

Frequently asked questions
--------------------------

*   ### Are plans commitment-free?
    
    You decide: you can pay monthly, and commit on a month-to-month basis or you can pay yearly, and commit for 12 months following your subscription. You can manage and change your subscription directly in the application.
    
*   ### Are signatures collected during my trial period legally binding?
    
    Yes. Every single signature processed through our app complies to security norms and generate legally binding proof of agreement. Moreover, all signatures created during the trial period will remain available in the application.
    
*   ### How do I subscribe to a plan?
    
    At any time during your trial period, you can confirm your subscription to Yousign directly in the application. Once you've entered your bank details and billing information, your plan will be immediately activated.
    
*   ### How can I pay?
    
    Payment methods accepted are credit card and direct debit. In the app, you’ll be able to set up credit card payments. Get in touch with our team if you’d prefer to be billed using a different payment method.
    
*   ### How will I be billed?
    
    If you’ve picked monthly billing, you will be billed each month. If you’ve selected annual billing, you will pay your yearly amount upfront.
    

*   ### What happens when I hit my signature request limits?
    
    Aside from the One plan, you can create as many signature requests as you want. If you reach your signature limit with One, you'll still be able to create drafts and send them the month afterwards, or change plan in your application.
    
*   ### What is a 'Signature request'?
    
    An invitation to sign is the whole operation of preparing and sending one or more documents to be signed electronically by one or more signers at once. It can contain as many documents as you want and up to 100 signers.
    
*   ### Do Yousign's electronic signatures have a time-stamped certificate?
    
    All our simple and advanced eSignatures are time-stamped, regardless of the offer. The timestamp is included in the evidence file (document attesting to the signature, which can be downloaded as an annex to each signature procedure).
    
*   ### What is the FREE plan?
    
    The FREE plan gives you access to a secure & legally binding eSignature solution. With this plan, you can discover the benefits of using Yousign for free. The plan allows you to self-sign your own documents (unlimited) and send 2 invitations to sign/month. Certain features are accessible only on paying plans. Please check the feature-per-feature comparison of each plan for more information.
    
*   ### Who can subscribe to the FREE plan?
    
    Anyone can subscribe to the FREE plan. You can subscribe to the FREE plan for your professional use or for your private or household use. Different terms and conditions apply though. Please check our [Terms of use and subscription](https://yousign.com/terms) for more information.

Frequently asked questions
--------------------------

*   ### Are plans commitment-free?
    
    You decide: you can pay monthly, and commit on a month-to-month basis or you can pay yearly, and commit for 12 months following your subscription. You can manage and change your subscription directly in the application.
    
*   ### Are signatures collected during my trial period legally binding?
    
    Yes. Every single signature processed through our app complies to security norms and generate legally binding proof of agreement. Moreover, all signatures created during the trial period will remain available in the application.
    
*   ### How do I subscribe to a plan?
    
    At any time during your trial period, you can confirm your subscription to Yousign directly in the application. Once you've entered your bank details and billing information, your plan will be immediately activated.
    
*   ### How can I pay?
    
    Payment methods accepted are credit card and direct debit. In the app, you’ll be able to set up credit card payments. Get in touch with our team if you’d prefer to be billed using a different payment method.
    
*   ### How will I be billed?
    
    If you’ve picked monthly billing, you will be billed each month. If you’ve selected annual billing, you will pay your yearly amount upfront.
    

*   ### What happens when I hit my signature request limits?
    
    Aside from the One plan, you can create as many signature requests as you want. If you reach your signature limit with One, you'll still be able to create drafts and send them the month afterwards, or change plan in your application.
    
*   ### What is a 'Signature request'?
    
    An invitation to sign is the whole operation of preparing and sending one or more documents to be signed electronically by one or more signers at once. It can contain as many documents as you want and up to 100 signers.
    
*   ### Do Yousign's electronic signatures have a time-stamped certificate?
    
    All our simple and advanced eSignatures are time-stamped, regardless of the offer. The timestamp is included in the evidence file (document attesting to the signature, which can be downloaded as an annex to each signature procedure).
    
*   ### What is the FREE plan?
    
    The FREE plan gives you access to a secure & legally binding eSignature solution. With this plan, you can discover the benefits of using Yousign for free. The plan allows you to self-sign your own documents (unlimited) and send 2 invitations to sign/month. Certain features are accessible only on paying plans. Please check the feature-per-feature comparison of each plan for more information.
    
*   ### Who can subscribe to the FREE plan?
    
    Anyone can subscribe to the FREE plan. You can subscribe to the FREE plan for your professional use or for your private or household use. Different terms and conditions apply though. Please check our [Terms of use and subscription](https://yousign.com/terms) for more information.
